intro: Aulomyrcia cymosa, commonly known as the clustered sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of white to pale purple. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Aulomyrcia cymosa is adapted to drought conditions and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
